posts.content:
Hi
Any recommendation for the area between Brussels and Liege?
On our way to a wedding in Bonn in July and thios will be our first stop over after getting off the ferry at Dunkirk.

Or a good resource for finding good campsites in europe/Belgium/Germany.

Don't really like the big holiday camp ones, would prefer small ish and friendly

Thanks guys
Rich

im not sure either.. i'm looking for the best campsites just outside Munich, Salzburg, Neuswanstein, Mont Blanc area, Paris? any advice much appreciated on the best bus friendly spots, prob looking to park up for a few days in Paris. cheers

What you guys need is this book!!

I've got the 2007&2011 edition and they're worth to get it, believe me.. I've used it over the past yrs traveling around Europe and it's very recommendable !

It's mainly stopovers, "aires", "municipals" and just free spots as well as a few "cheaper" campsites, the book tells you whether it has, electricity, showers, toilets, etc and how much it costs if you have to pay!

Cheers guys that looks great,
I'll have a read up on it and see what the misses thinks, we've also got the rough guide to Belgium and holland which are normally good for general info but not much detail on camping
Cheers
Rich
